info.title: Seren DB
info.description: Create, manage, and query SerenDB serverless Postgres databases.

get.summary: List all projects in the organization.

post.summary: Create a new SerenDB project.

get.summary: Get a project by ID.
List branch protection rules for a project.

Get branch details.

Set a branch as default using set_as_default alias.

AddIpAllowListRequest.description: Request to add an IP to the allow list

description.description: Optional description for this IP entry

ip_address.description: IP address or CIDR range (e.g., "192.168.1.0/24" or "10.0.0.1")

Branch.description: Branch represents a SerenDB timeline (database copy)

is_default.description:
Computed field: true if this branch is the project's default branch.
Not stored in DB - computed by comparing branch.id with project.default_branch_id.
True if this is the project's default branch

BranchCreationResult.description: Response wrapper returned when branch creation provisions auxiliary resources

endpoint_error.description:
Error message if endpoint provisioning failed.
When present, the branch was created successfully but the endpoint failed.
The UI should show a "Retry" or "Add Compute" button.

backup_branch.description: The backup branch containing the pre-restore state

ConnectionString.description:
Response for a single, canonical connection string.

The backend always prefers SerenDB proxy-based connection strings when
proxy configuration is available, and falls back to direct compute
connection strings only when the proxy is not configured.

connection_string.description: Fully resolved PostgreSQL connection string (proxy preferred).

ConsumptionSummary.description: ConsumptionSummary represents aggregated usage for a period

CreateBranchProtectionRequest.description: Request to create or update branch protection

CreateBranchRequest.description: Request to create a new branch

add_endpoint.description:
Whether to automatically create an endpoint for this branch.
Defaults to true.
Set to false to create a branch without compute (equivalent to --no-compute).

expires_at.description:
Optional expiration timestamp for auto-deletion of this branch.
Useful for temporary dev/preview branches.

schema_only.description:
Create branch with schema only (no data).
When true, only the database schema is copied, not the data.

CreateDatabaseRequest.description: Request to create a new database

CreateDbRoleRequest.description: Request to create a new PostgreSQL database role

CreateEndpointRequest.description: Request to create a new endpoint

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (default) or read_only (replica)

name.description: Optional name for the endpoint. If not provided, a name will be auto-generated.

CreateProjectRequest.description: Request to create a new project

enable_logical_replication.description:
Enable logical replication for this project. Sets wal_level=logical for all compute endpoints.
Once enabled, this cannot be disabled.

tables.description: Tables to include (empty/null means ALL TABLES)

CreateReplicationSlotRequest.description: Request to create a replication slot

slot_type.description: Slot type: logical or physical (default: logical)

data.description: Branch represents a SerenDB timeline (database copy)

is_default.description:
Computed field: true if this branch is the project's default branch.
Not stored in DB - computed by comparing branch.id with project.default_branch_id.

data.description: Response wrapper returned when branch creation provisions auxiliary resources

endpoint_error.description:
Error message if endpoint provisioning failed.
When present, the branch was created successfully but the endpoint failed.
The UI should show a "Retry" or "Add Compute" button.

data.description: Response for branch detail information
Branch protection response (API output)
Response after restoring a branch

backup_branch.description: The backup branch containing the pre-restore state

data.description:
Response for a single, canonical connection string.

The backend always prefers SerenDB proxy-based connection strings when
proxy configuration is available, and falls back to direct compute
connection strings only when the proxy is not configured.

connection_string.description: Fully resolved PostgreSQL connection string (proxy preferred).

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas (NULL for read_write endpoints)

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (primary) or read_only (replica)

enable_logical_replication.description: Whether logical replication is enabled for this project

is_service_project.description: Whether this is a service project (hidden from normal listings, contains seren_* databases)

Computed field: true if this branch is the project's default branch.
Not stored in DB - computed by comparing branch.id with project.default_branch_id.

items.description: Database with owner role name included

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas (NULL for read_write endpoints)

items.description: IP allow list entry for project-level access control

ip_address.description: IP address or CIDR range (stored as PostgreSQL CIDR type)

items.description: Project represents a SerenDB database instance

is_service_project.description: Whether this is a service project (hidden from normal listings, contains seren_* databases)

tables.description: Tables to replicate (empty means ALL TABLES)

DatabaseWithOwner.description: Database with owner role name included

Endpoint.description: Endpoint represents a compute instance for a branch

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (primary) or read_only (replica)

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas (NULL for read_write endpoints)

endpoint_type.description: Type of endpoint: read_write (primary) or read_only (replica)

primary_endpoint_id.description: Reference to the primary endpoint for read replicas

EndpointStatusInfo.description: Status response used by lifecycle endpoints

EndpointType.description: Endpoint type enum - distinguishes between primary and replica endpoints

IpAllowList.description: IP allow list entry for project-level access control

ip_address.description: IP address or CIDR range (stored as PostgreSQL CIDR type)

LsnByTimestamp.description: Response for LSN by timestamp query

count.description: Number of items in this response

has_more.description: Whether there are more items after this page

total.description: Total number of items across all pages

oneOf.description: Log Sequence Number from PostgreSQL WAL

PointInTime.description: Point in time specification (timestamp or LSN)

Project.description: Project represents a SerenDB database instance

is_service_project.description: Whether this is a service project (hidden from normal listings, contains seren_* databases)

ProjectConsumption.description: ProjectConsumption wraps consumption data for API responses

default_branch_id.description: The main branch for this project

enable_logical_replication.description: Whether logical replication is enabled for this project

is_service_project.description: Whether this is a service project (hidden from normal listings, contains seren_* databases)

tables.description: Tables to replicate (empty means ALL TABLES)

QueryRequest.description: JSON body for the query endpoint.

branch_id.description: Branch ID (uses default branch if omitted)

read_only.description: Execute query in a read-only transaction (defaults to true).

QueryResult.description: Query result returned to the caller.

ResetBranchRequest.description: Request to reset a branch to its parent's latest state

parent.description: Whether to reset to parent (currently the only supported option)

ResetIpAllowListEntry.description: Entry used when resetting the IP allow list

ip_address.description: IP address or CIDR range to allow

ResetIpAllowListRequest.description: Request to replace the entire IP allow list

entries.description:
Entries that should remain in the allow list after the reset.
Empty list means the allow list is cleared.

RestoreBranchRequest.description: Request to restore a branch to a point in time

preserve_under_name.description: Name for the backup branch that will preserve the current state

oneOf.description: Restore to an earlier point in the branch's own history
Restore to parent branch (optionally at a point in time)
Restore to a specific source branch (optionally at a point in time)

SetBranchArchivedRequest.description: Request to set branch archived status

TimestampByLsn.description: Response for timestamp by LSN query

UpdateLogicalReplicationRequest.description: Request to update logical replication settings

enable_logical_replication.description:
Enable logical replication for this project. Sets wal_level=logical for all compute endpoints.
Once enabled, this cannot be disabled. Enabling will suspend all active endpoints.

history_retention_seconds.description:
History retention period in seconds for point-in-time recovery (PITR).
Determines how far back you can create branches from historical data.
Default is 21600 (6 hours). Minimum is 3600 (1 hour). Maximum is 2592000 (30 days).
